contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2011}} '''Jules Rattankoemar Ajodhia''' (27 January 1945 in [[Wanica District]]) is a [[Suriname]]se politician. From 1988 to 1990, he was Justice Minister. He was also twice vice president of Suriname.<ref>{{Cite web | title = US State Department Background on Suriname | url = http://www.state.gov/r/pa/ei/bgn/1893.htm | accessdate = 5 January 2011}}</ref> The first term was from 16 September 1991 to 15 September 1996.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Carter Center Report on 1991 Suriname Elections | url = http://www.cartercenter.org/countries/suriname.html | accessdate = 5 January 2011}}</ref> The second term started on 12 August 2000 and ended on 12 August 2005. He is currently a member of the parliament and deputy chairman of the political party [[Progressive Reform Party (Suriname)|VHP]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME =Ajodhia, Jules | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Surinamese politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 27 January 1945 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ajodhia, Jules}} [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Wanica District]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of Suriname]] [[Category:Surinamese Hindus]] [[Category:Surinamese people of Indian descent]] [[Category:Members of the National Assembly of Suriname]] [[Category:Progressive Reform Party (Suriname) politicians]] [[Category:Honorary Order of the Yellow Star]] {{Suriname-politician-stub}}
